alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 9:58AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Whiteside, Rock Island, northwestern Henry, Scott, southeastern Clinton, eastern Muscatine and southeastern Cedar Counties through 1045 AM CDT... At 958 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Durant, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Blue Grass and Montpelier around 1010 AM CDT. Walcott and Andalusia around 1015 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Buffalo, Davenport, Rock Island, Riverdale, Moline, Bettendorf, East Moline, Silvis, Colona, Le Claire, Coal Valley, Hampton, Port Byron, Rapids City, Cleveland and Osborn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 273 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 17. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 16. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and east central Iowa.
